intro: Hackelia leptophylla var. besseyi, commonly known as the Bessey's bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, often appearing in opposite pairs along the stem. This variety is part of the Geraniaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant landscapes.
